intro: Gethyllis polyanthera, commonly known as the Cape orchid, is a flowering plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the Orchidaceae family and is characterized by its delicate, fragrant flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky or sandy soils and thrives in coastal areas. Its flowers are usually white or pale pink and bloom in spring. It is a small, herbaceous perennial that is often found in coastal fynbos vegetation.
